name: Reconstructing cerebellar evoked LFP
short_description: The model allows reconstruction of evoked local field potentials as seen in the cerebellar granular layer. The approach uses a detailed model of cerebellar granule neuron to generate data traces and then uses a "ReConv" or jittered repetitive convolution technique to reproduce post-synaptic local field potentials in the granular layer. The algorithm was used to generate both in vitro and in vivo evoked LFP and reflected the changes seen during LTP and LTD, when such changes were induced in the underlying neurons by modulating release probability of synapses and sodium channel regulated intrinsic excitability of the cells. See Diwakar S, Lombardo P, Solinas S, Naldi G, D`Angelo E (2011) Local field potential modeling predicts dense activation in cerebellar granule cells clusters under LTP and LTD control PLoS ONE 6(7):e21928
summary: ReConv algorithm for cerebellum LFP reconstruction
